p: People in developing countries are more susceptible to heat-related mortality than developed countries due to limited adaptive capacity and vulnerability [ 16]. However, most of heat-related epidemiological studies were conducted in developed countries (e.g., USA and European countries) [ 2, 4]. As the largest developing country, China has experienced a rapid aging of the population in recent years [ 17], which may also lead to an increased health burden from heat [ 3]. Nevertheless, only a limited number of studies have explored the adverse health impact of heat wave in China, especially in the inland provinces including some major cities [ 18].
